intro: Leonohebe petriei var. murrellii, commonly known as the Murrell's leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
